meanings.sent1: The children exchanged cheerful hullos in the morning.
meanings.sent2: He received warm hullos from his friends at the party.
meanings.sent3: The hullos between the two dogs sounded like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The hullos of the birds in the trees welcomed the sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The hullos of the crowd filled the stadium with excitement.

meanings.definition: To say hello or greet someone.
meanings.sent1: She hullos to her neighbors every time she sees them.
meanings.sent2: They hullos to each other before starting their conversation.
meanings.sent3: The cat hullos to the birds outside, hoping to make new friends.
meanings.sent4: The flowers hullos to the bees, inviting them to pollinate.
meanings.sent5: The old friends hullos warmly after years of not seeing each other.

meanings.definition: A friendly or informal way of saying hello.
meanings.sent1: Their hullos always brighten up my day.
meanings.sent2: The hullos from the staff make the customers feel welcome.
meanings.sent3: The robot's mechanical hullos amused the children at the fair.
meanings.sent4: The gentle hullos of the wind whispered through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The hullos of the waves greeted the shore with a calming rhythm.
